etymology.description: Depicts a bed -> component in other characters such as 牀
etymology.interpretation: 爿(爿) (pán, 'bed') originally illustrated a bed, which is why it still appears as a component in characters related to artifacts like 牀(牀) (chuáng, 'bed').
etymology.simplification: 丬 is a simplified and variant form of 爿, used as a contracted component in characters to streamline writing.

examples.chinese: 汉字中丬起着语音提示作用(漢字中丬起着語音提示作用)。
examples.pinyin: Hànzì zhōng jiāng qǐ zhe yǔyīn tíshì zuòyòng.
examples.english: In Chinese characters, the phonetic component 丬 serves as a sound cue.

examples.chinese: 在造字过程中(在造字過程中)，研究者利用丬作声旁(研究者利用丬作聲旁)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zàozì guòchéng zhōng, yánjiū zhě lìyòng jiāng zuò shēng páng.
examples.english: During the process of forming characters, researchers use 丬 as a phonetic element.
